snippet: A Bronx teenager honored as Police Commissioner for a Day struggled to overcome the aftereffects of a crime that occurred on his way to school.
abstract: Michael Wilson Crime Scene column on Eric LaBoy, Bronx teenager who was honored in 2011 as Police Commissioner for a Day, and who now struggles to overcome the psychological aftermath of being robbed by two older boys on his way to school.
lead_paragraph: A Bronx teenager honored as Police Commissioner for a Day struggled to overcome the aftereffects of a crime that occurred on his way to school.

headline.seo: A Boy Robbed of His iPod, and, for a Time, His Nerve
headline.main: A Boy Robbed of His iPod, and, for a Time, His Nerve
headline.print_headline: A Boy Robbed of His iPod, and, for a Time, His Nerve
